data.full_story: The province was created as a Chief Commissioner's Province by integrating 30 princely states, later becoming a full state in 1971.
data.ai_insight: Unity among hills creates a peak of stability.

data.title: First Passenger Train in India
data.short_summary: The train ran from Bori Bunder to Thane.
data.full_story: The 14-carriage train hauled by three steam locomotives (Sahib, Sindh, and Sultan) covered 34 km, starting the Indian Railways era.
data.ai_insight: Tracks connect more than just stations; they connect the people.

data.title: Death of Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan
data.short_summary: Passing of India's second President and philosopher.
data.full_story: A brilliant scholar of comparative religion and philosophy, his birthday (Sept 5) is celebrated as Teachers' Day in India.
data.ai_insight: Wisdom is the highest form of leadership.

data.title: Chittagong Armoury Raid
data.short_summary: Surya Sen led a raid on the British armoury.
data.full_story: Revolutionaries attempted to seize the armoury of police and auxiliary forces in Chittagong to declare an independent republic.
data.ai_insight: The bold are those who dare to dream of freedom in the heart of danger.

data.title: Launch of Aryabhata Satellite
data.short_summary: India's first satellite was launched into space.
data.full_story: Named after the ancient astronomer, the satellite was launched by the Soviet Union, marking India's entry into the space age.
data.ai_insight: To look at the stars is to see the future of our nation.

data.title: Birth of Miguel Díaz-Canel (Legacy)
data.short_summary: Focus on Indo-Cuban relations.
data.full_story: India was one of the first countries to recognize the Cuban government, and the two nations have shared deep diplomatic ties in the Non-Aligned Movement.
data.ai_insight: Diplomacy is about finding common ground across distant shores.

data.title: National Civil Services Day
data.short_summary: Sardar Patel addressed the first batch of civil servants.
data.full_story: Patel referred to civil servants as the 'Steel Frame of India,' urging them to serve with dedication and integrity.
data.ai_insight: A nation is only as strong as the administration that serves it.

data.title: First Usage of Chemical Weapons (Impact on India)
data.short_summary: Indian soldiers in WWI faced chemical attacks.
data.full_story: During the Battle of Ypres, Indian troops were among those exposed to chlorine gas, highlighting the horrors faced by Indian soldiers in foreign wars.
data.ai_insight: The scars of war are borne by those far from home.

data.title: Death of Satyajit Ray
data.short_summary: Passing of the legendary filmmaker.
data.full_story: The director of the 'Apu Trilogy' and an Oscar winner, Ray brought Indian cinema to the international stage with his humanist storytelling.
data.ai_insight: A great story is a mirror where the whole world can see itself.

data.title: Kesavananda Bharati Judgment
data.short_summary: The Supreme Court defined the 'Basic Structure' doctrine.
data.full_story: In a 7:6 verdict, the court ruled that while Parliament can amend the Constitution, it cannot alter its basic structure.
data.ai_insight: The soul of the Constitution is protected from the whims of time.

data.title: Solar Cell Demonstration (India's Solar Journey)
data.short_summary: The first practical silicon solar cell was shown.
data.full_story: While global, this event set the stage for India’s eventual leadership in the International Solar Alliance decades later.
data.ai_insight: The sun is the ultimate source of energy and independence.

data.title: South Africa's First Democratic Election (India's Support)
data.short_summary: End of Apartheid; India was a staunch supporter.
data.full_story: India was the first country to break trade relations with the apartheid regime and among the first to welcome the new democratic South Africa.
data.ai_insight: Justice for one is a victory for all who believe in equality.

data.title: Death of Feroz Khan (Legacy)
data.short_summary: The 'Clint Eastwood of the East' passed away.
data.full_story: A legendary actor and director, Feroz Khan was known for his stylish filmmaking and his contribution to the 'Western' genre in Bollywood.
data.ai_insight: Style is the signature of an artist's soul.

data.title: Yellow Fever Vaccine (Health in India)
data.short_summary: Breakthrough in tropical medicine.
data.full_story: Advances in tropical disease research during this era significantly impacted public health policies in India.
data.ai_insight: Health is the true wealth of a growing population.

data.title: Birth of Raja Ravi Varma
data.short_summary: Birth of the 'Father of Modern Indian Art'.
data.full_story: He blended European academic art with Indian iconography, making art accessible to the masses through lithographs.
data.ai_insight: Art is the bridge between the divine and the everyday.

data.title: Death of Mahmud of Ghazni (Impact on History)
data.short_summary: The passing of the conqueror of Somnath.
data.full_story: His invasions significantly altered the political and religious landscape of North India, leading to the medieval era of transitions.
data.ai_insight: History is written in the shifts of power and the endurance of culture.
